intro: Cyrtandra augusti, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra augusti is also noted for its role in the unique ecological systems of Hawaii, supporting various native pollinators.
